data.title: Midnight Light Festival in Vilhelmina 6
data.meta_description: Midnight Light Festival – a unique festival in the north of Sweden. 6th – 7th of July, Ending a week full of various cultural events.
data.text:
The Festival

It was born from a desire. A desire to bring people together and to inject the northern countryside with live music. The bright summer nights serve as a magical backdrop for the music and combined with the closeness of the forest, the mountains in the distance and the never-ending fresh air in your lungs, something remarkable and truly spectacular!

It is a diverse festival for the masses with acts ranging from an array of musical styles. Surrounding activities on the festival site, such as a skate jam, an exhibition of old Volvos, food stands, a bowling alley, a batting cage, table tennis, lounge area, DJ:s and art installments create an atmosphere suitable for everyone. Alongside the festival there is a meet for folk musicians on the area during daytime.

For those of you who enjoy a healthy meal and a refreshing beverage while lending your ears to some high quality live music there’s a barbeque buffet with free admittance between 5 pm and 8 pm. After 8 pm there is an age limit of 18-years and an entry fee. This year’s festival line-up is available on flyers that you can find on the train or visit the website www. midnightlightfestival.se

Accommodation and other activities

As mentioned earlier there are lots of activities on the festival grounds to fill the time between your new favourite bands. If you are in the mood for exploring the town of Vilhelmina during daytime the Tourist Office is right across the street from Folkets Hus. They will help you wherever you want to go.

There are a lot of places to stay in Vilhelmina: STF Kyrkstan, Hotell Wilhelmina, Lilla Hotellet, Kålgårdens Camping, and Lundqvists Motell. The official festival camping; Saiva Camping is just a 10 minute walk from the festival site, Saiva is located right next to the lake Baksjön and offers a familiar environment suitable for festival goers of all ages. With a sandy beach, several fire places, an outside gym, tennis courts, a playground, football fields, a hockey range, an obstacle course and great fishing places, there are plenty of ways to keep active or to just relax all day long.

Our appeal

If you are considering returning to Vilhelmina and South Lapland, keep us and the second weekend of July in mind! A weekend of long days and never ending bright nights, full of musical entertainment and activities all around our wonderful town.

Follow us on Instagram and Facebook to stay updated, and save the date: the 6th and 7th of July!
